javadoc.text: * PNodeLocator provides an abstraction for locating points on a node. * Points are located in the local corrdinate system of the node. The default * behavior is to locate the center point of the nodes bounds. The node where * the point is located is stored internal to this locator (as an instance * varriable). If you want to use the same locator to locate center points on * many different nodes you will need to call setNode() before asking for each * location. *
javadoc.author: Jesse Grosjean

javadoc.text: * Node being located by this locator.
* Constructs a locator responsible for locating the given node.
* Returns the node being located by this locator.
javadoc.return: node being located by this locator

javadoc.text: * Changes the node being located by this locator.
javadoc.param: node new node to have this locator locate.

javadoc.text: * Locates the left of the target node's bounds.
* Locates the top of the target node's bounds.
